page.title: 13Transport in Plym.St.Mary.
page.content: Transport is a necessity in this area.Plymouth being the closest large town from which to buy any commodity. Therefor in order to get there the locals need some form of{personal {transport. { Cyclists}are seen about the area.These tend to be youngsters doing errands or going to see friends.The undulating nature of the terrain makes it tiring to go too far. { Cars}of all ages wend their way around,interspersed with{farm tractors or{heavy lorries}taking spoil from local developments. There are{no bus services except {along the A.38 but there is}a school bus which collects children from out- lying farms and delivers them to Ivybridge Community College in the morning and back in the evening.
